summary:
R is a free and open-source programming language used for statistics and data analysis. It is popular in fields like data mining and bioinformatics. The language can be extended with additional packages, making it very versatile.

Written in C, Fortran, and R, it can run on different operating systems. R has a command-line interface, but users often prefer graphical interfaces like RStudio, which is like a special R editor, or Jupyter, which lets you work in notebooks.
title: R (programming language)
